newsitem.title: RUSSIA: SOCCER-TWO SENT OFF AS BRAZIL DRAW WITH RUSSIA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-TWO SENT OFF AS BRAZIL DRAW WITH RUSSIA.

text.p: Russian captain Viktor Onopko and Brazil's Cafu were both sent off as the two countries drew 2-2 in a friendly soccer match in Moscow on Wednesday.
With the scores pegged at 1-1 Cafu was given his marching orders and then, with five minutes remaining, the Russian captain was also shown the red card after insulting the referee.
The Russians, playing their first game under new coach Boris Ignatiev, had made the early breakthrough when defender Yuri Nikiforov converted a penalty in the 18th minute.
Trailing 1-0 at the break, the Brazilians came back two minutes into the second half when half-back Donizetti made a run down the right-wing and equalised.
With Cafu off, the Russians regained the lead 10 minutes from time when substitute striker Vladislav Radimov scored from long range.
Five minutes later, Ronaldo fired home the second penalty of the night to level the scores.
Brazil play the second match of their short European tour against the Netherlands on Saturday.
